topics_and_summary.datasets.structured_dataset module¶

class topics_and_summary.datasets.structured_dataset.StructuredDataset(dataset_path: str, encoding: str)[source]¶

Bases: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Dataset

Class that represents a dataset structured in folders. Each folder contains an specific set of related documents.

apply_function_to_files(func: Callable)[source]¶

Applies the given function to each of the text files in the corpus.

Parameters

func – The function to be applied to each text file.

remove_document(category: str, index_in_category: int)[source]¶

Removes from the dataset the document in the given category with the given index inside that category.

Parameters

  • category – Category of the document.

  • index_in_category – Index of the document inside that category.

as_dataframe() → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Returns the files_dict as a pandas DataFrame.

as_documents_content_list(tokenize_words=True)[source]¶

Returns a list of the content of the documents in the dataset.

Parameters

tokenize_words – If true, each document content is converted into a list of words.

Returns

List of the content of the documents in the dataset.

as_documents_obj_list(tokenize_words=True) → List[topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Document][source]¶

Returns a list of Document objects of the documents in the dataset.

Parameters

tokenize_words – If true, each document content is converted into a list of words.

Returns

List of Document objects of the documents in the dataset.

get_document_index(category: str, doc_name: str)[source]¶

Returns the index of the specified document.

Parameters

  • category – Category of the document.

  • doc_name – Name of the document.

Returns

Returns the index of the specified document or -1 if the documents isn’t in the dataset.

class topics_and_summary.datasets.structured_dataset.StructuredDocument(directory_name: str, name: str, content: str = None)[source]¶

Bases: topics_and_summary.datasets.common.Document

Class that represents a document inside a category folder. This documents have an additional attribute ‘directory_name’, because documents in this dataset are stored in folders.

get_doc_path_inside_dataset_folder() → str[source]¶

Returns the relative path of the document inside the dataset directory.
